alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:35AM PST until January 11 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 4000 feet expected. Snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches with higher amounts above 5500 ft. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western and southern Siskiyou County, including parts of Highway 89 at Snowman Summit, Interstate 5 at Black Butte Summit, Highway 3 south out of Callahan including Sawyers Bar Road, Tennant and the Mt. Shasta Ski Park. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise through the evening, with periods of snow affecting 4500 feet this afternoon and evening before the snow levels rise to 6000 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
